intro: Wikstroemia jiulongensis, commonly known as the Jiulongshan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid environments. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in dry and sunny conditions.
